content: fabulous felted pillow cover skill level easy/intermediate finished size approx 12 to 14 square - measures approx 16-1/2 square before felting materials note do not use white off-white or superwash wool as it will not felt bulky weight wool or wool-mohair blend yarn that felts easily sample shown in assorted colors of brown sheep lamb s pride bulky with fizz eyelash accent approx 125 yds each of 5 to 7 different colors of wool yarn approx 50 yds of novelty eyelash yarn for accent - or - scraps of wool yarns in several colors totaling about 600 yds plus - 100 yds of one solid color wool yarn for final edging rounds and seams size p/16 11 5 mm crochet hook or size needed to achieve gauge tapestry needle gauge 7 single_crochet 7 row = 4 with bulky wt wool on size p/16 11 5 mm hook technique row of single_crochet are worked to measure approx 22 to 24 square then the corner points are brought together at center back with slip-stitch seams prior to felting stitches/terms beginning beg chain chain repeat repeat single_crochet single_crochet slip_stitch sl st stitch st notes work loosely to allow for maximum felting action work in a randomly striped pattern changing colors as desired and occasionally holding a strand of eyelash together with the wool on some of the row at color changes cut old color and join in new color as necessary leaving 4 tails for weaving in ends securely prior to felting 1 pillow cover row 1 with bulky wt wool and size p hook chain 37 loosely single_crochet in second chain from hook and in ea chain across 36 single_crochet row 2 chain 1 turn single_crochet in ea single_crochet across 36 single_crochet repeat row 2 changing colors at random varying width of stripes and adding eyelash accent as desired until piece measures approx 22 to 24 square fasten_off edging round 1 attach solid trim color in any single_crochet along end of piece chain 1 single_crochet in same st and single_crochet in ea single_crochet and ea row around working 3 single_crochet in ea corner keeping gauge even and loose along all four sides with same number of stitches along ea side to maintain square shape join with slip_stitch to beg single_crochet round 2 chain 1 single_crochet in same single_crochet and in ea single_crochet around join with slip_stitch and fasten_off finishing seams with right sides together fold first row of piece up to meet final row of piece attach matching color yarn in first stitch along short side of piece at right inserting hook under both loops of each single_crochet on both front and back pieces work a slip_stitch seam across right edge of piece repeat on left edge of piece now bring side seams to center so that the four original corners of the piece meet in the center working from outside toward center attach yarn at right edge of the unsewn seam and work slip_stitch across toward center stopping 6 from center
